etymology.description: semantic: 页(頁) (yè, "page/head") + phonetic: 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") = physical head form -> head
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 页(頁) (yè, "page/head"), which provides a semantic component related to the top or head, with 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") for phonetic support, leading to the meaning "head."
etymology.simplification: 頭(頭)→头(頭): 豆(豆) retained, 页(頁) simplified by removing parts for a cursive shorthand resembling 大(大) (dà, "big") to maintain a visual association with 'head'.

examples.chinese: 他的头很大(他的頭很大)。
他的头发很浓密(他的頭髮很濃密)，闪耀着健康的光泽(閃耀著健康的光澤)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de tóufǎ hěn nóngmì, shǎnyào zhe jiànkāng de guāngzé.
examples.english: His hair is thick, radiating the glow of health.

examples.chinese: 他跑到山头上(他跑到山頭上)，俯瞰整个村庄(俯瞰整個村莊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā pǎo dào shāntóu shàng, fǔkàn zhěnggè cūnzhuāng.
examples.english: He ran to the hilltop and looked down over the entire village.
